meanings.definition: A person who habitually spreads intimate or private rumors or facts.
meanings.sent1: The gossippers in the office always have the latest news about everyone.
meanings.sent2: The small town was full of gossippers who knew everything about everyone.
meanings.sent3: The gossippers at the party were like walking newspapers, sharing stories left and right.
meanings.sent4: Her words spread through the group like wildfire, earning her the title of the queen of gossippers.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the gossippers, for their tongues are sharper than any sword.
